content: @Grahame Grieve, @Brett Marquard and I are exploring options for validating IGs against US Core that don't strictly comply with US Core to better understand deviation and allow US Realm to help manage those deviations. I know you've built that capability. I thought it was in the validator, but I don't see instructions on how to use it here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Using+the+FHIR+Validator. Is it somewhere else?

Thanks Lloyd. We are having a pretty intense debate about how to keep items in alignment without requiring deriviation. I suspect @Eric Haas @Frank McKinney and @Steve Posnack will be interested in the outcome.
it was in the notes from the tutorial around IG comparison
I'll write it up when this weeks project is ready (a GUI for the validator)
thanks Grahame. Surfacing this will help folks in the interim while US Base isn't available
